getBamStatsReport.string_process:
process getBamStatsReport {
    beforeScript "source ${params.processConfigFile}"
    container params.bamstatsImage
    clusterOptions = params.clusterOptions
    queue = params.serverOptions['queue']
    time =  params.serverOptions['time']

    input:
    tuple val(bamBase), path(bamFile)

    script:
    """
    mkdir -p ${params.outputDir}quality-reports/aligned/
    java -Xmx8g -jar ${params.bamstatsJar} \
        -i ${bamFile} \
        -v html \
        -o ${params.outputDir}quality-reports/aligned/${bamBase}.bamstats.html 
    """
}

getDepthOfCoverageReport.string_process:
process getDepthOfCoverageReport {
    beforeScript "source ${params.processConfigFile}"
    container params.gatk4Image
    clusterOptions = params.clusterOptions
    queue = params.serverOptions['queue']
    time =  params.serverOptions['time']

    input:
    tuple val(bamBase), path(bamFile)

    script:
    """
    mkdir -p ${params.outputDir}quality-reports/aligned/
    gatk \
        DepthOfCoverage \
        -R ${params.referenceSequence['path']} \
        -O ${params.outputDir}quality-reports/alined/${bamBase}.depthofcov \
        -I ${bamFile} \
        -L []
    """
}

tools_dico.name: GATK
tools_dico.description:
The Genome Analysis Toolkit (GATK) is a set of bioinformatic tools for analyzing high-throughput sequencing (HTS) and variant call format (VCF) data. The toolkit is well established for germline short variant discovery from whole genome and exome sequencing data. GATK4 expands functionality into copy number and somatic analyses and offers pipeline scripts for workflows.  

Version 4 (GATK4) is open-source at https://github.com/broadinstitute/gatk.

mutateReference.string_process:
process mutateReference {
	label 'withMaxMemory'
	label 'withMaxCpus'
	label 'withMaxTime'
	container params.simulatorImage

	input:
	path simulationInputs

	output:
	tuple path(simulationInputs), path("${params.referenceSequence['label']}.mutated.fa"), path("${params.cohortId}.truth.g.vcf")

	script:
	"""
	simulate MutateReference \
		--input_ref ${params.referenceSequence['path']} \
		--output_ref ${params.referenceSequence['label']}.mutated.fa \
		--input_json ${simulationInputs} \
		--output_vcf ${params.cohortId}.truth.g.vcf
	"""
}

tools_dico.name: SIMULATE
tools_dico.description: A program to simulate genotypes in family members for a map of linked markers unlinked to a given affection status locus. the output is ready for analysis with UNKNOWN, ISIM, LSIM, or MSIM of the SLINK package.

sortTruthVcfFile.string_process:
process sortTruthVcfFile {
	label 'withMaxMemory'
	label 'withMaxCpus'
	label 'withMaxTime'
	container params.bcftoolsImage

	input:
	tuple path(simulationInputs), path(mutatedReference), path(truthVcfFile)

	output:
	tuple path(simulationInputs), path(mutatedReference)

	script:
	"""
	mkdir -p ${params.variantSetsDir}
	bcftools sort \
		${truthVcfFile} \
		-o ${params.variantSetsDir}/${params.cohortId}.truth.g.vcf
	"""
}

tools_dico.name: BCFtools
tools_dico.description: Set of utilities that manipulate variant calls in the Variant Call Format (VCF) and its binary counterpart BCF. All commands work transparently with both VCFs and BCFs, both uncompressed and BGZF-compressed.

generateReads.string_process:
process generateReads {
	label 'withMaxMemory'
	label 'withMaxCpus'
	label 'withMaxTime'
	container params.simulatorImage

	input:
	tuple val(readsPrefix),  path(simulationInputs), path(mutatedReference)

	script:
	"""
	mkdir -p ${params.rawReadsDir}
	simulate GenerateReads \
		--input_ref ${mutatedReference} \
		--reads_prefix ${readsPrefix} \
		--input_json ${simulationInputs}
	"""
}

tools_dico.name: SIMULATE
tools_dico.description: A program to simulate genotypes in family members for a map of linked markers unlinked to a given affection status locus. the output is ready for analysis with UNKNOWN, ISIM, LSIM, or MSIM of the SLINK package.

combineSampleGvcfFiles.string_process:
process combineSampleGvcfFiles {
	label 'withMaxMemory'
	label 'withMaxCpus'
	label 'withMaxTime'
    container params.gatk4Image

	input:
	val gvcfList

	output:
	path "${params.cohortId}.g.vcf"

	script:
	"""
	gatk CombineGVCFs \
		-R ${params.referenceSequence['path']} \
		${gvcfList} \
		-O ${params.cohortId}.g.vcf
	"""
}

tools_dico.name: GATK
tools_dico.description:
The Genome Analysis Toolkit (GATK) is a set of bioinformatic tools for analyzing high-throughput sequencing (HTS) and variant call format (VCF) data. The toolkit is well established for germline short variant discovery from whole genome and exome sequencing data. GATK4 expands functionality into copy number and somatic analyses and offers pipeline scripts for workflows.  

Version 4 (GATK4) is open-source at https://github.com/broadinstitute/gatk.

genotypeCombinedGvcfFile.string_process:
process genotypeCombinedGvcfFile {
	label 'withMaxMemory'
	label 'withMaxCpus'
	label 'withMaxTime'
    container params.gatk4Image

	input:
	path combinedGvcfFile

	script:
	"""
	gatk GenotypeGVCFs \
		-R ${params.referenceSequence['path']} \
		-V ${params.cohortId}.g.vcf \
		-O ${params.variantSetsDir}${params.cohortId}.genotyped.g.vcf
	"""
}

tools_dico.name: GATK
tools_dico.description:
The Genome Analysis Toolkit (GATK) is a set of bioinformatic tools for analyzing high-throughput sequencing (HTS) and variant call format (VCF) data. The toolkit is well established for germline short variant discovery from whole genome and exome sequencing data. GATK4 expands functionality into copy number and somatic analyses and offers pipeline scripts for workflows.  

Version 4 (GATK4) is open-source at https://github.com/broadinstitute/gatk.

getFastaQualityReport.string_process:
process getFastaQualityReport {
    label 'withMaxMemory'
    label 'withMaxCpus'
    label 'withMaxTime'
    container params.fastqcImage

	input:
	tuple val(name), file(reads)

    script:
    """
    mkdir -p ${params.qualityReportsDir}/trimmed
    fastqc \
    	-t ${task.cpus} \
    	-o ${params.qualityReportsDir}/trimmed \
    	${reads[0]} ${reads[1]}
    """
}

tools_dico.name: FastQC
tools_dico.description: This tool aims to provide a QC report which can spot problems or biases which originate either in the sequencer or in the starting library material. It can be run in one of two modes. It can either run as a stand alone interactive application for the immediate analysis of small numbers of FastQ files, or it can be run in a non-interactive mode where it would be suitable for integrating into a larger analysis pipeline for the systematic processing of large numbers of files.

alignReadsToReference.string_process:
process alignReadsToReference {
    label 'withMaxMemory'
    label 'withMaxCpus'
    label 'withMaxTime'
    container params.bwaImage

    input:
    tuple val(name), path(readsFilePair)

    output:
    tuple val(name), path("${name}.bam")

    script:
    """
    bwa mem \
        -t ${task.cpus} \
        -R \"@RG\\tID:${params.runId}\\tPU:${params.runId}\\tSM:${name}\\tLB:${name}\\tPL:${params.sequencingPlatform}\" \
        ${params.referenceSequence['dir']}/bwa.${params.referenceSequence['label']} \
        ${readsFilePair[0]} ${readsFilePair[1]} | \
            samtools view \
                -b - | \
                samtools sort \
                    -@ ${task.cpus} \
                    -o ${name}.bam
    """
}
alignReadsToReference.string_script:
"""
    bwa mem \
        -t ${task.cpus} \
        -R \"@RG\\tID:${params.runId}\\tPU:${params.runId}\\tSM:${name}\\tLB:${name}\\tPL:${params.sequencingPlatform}\" \
        ${params.referenceSequence['dir']}/bwa.${params.referenceSequence['label']} \
        ${readsFilePair[0]} ${readsFilePair[1]} | \
            samtools view \
                -b - | \
                samtools sort \
                    -@ ${task.cpus} \
                    -o ${name}.bam
    """

tools_dico.name: BWA
tools_dico.description: Fast, accurate, memory-efficient aligner for short and long sequencing reads

tools_dico.name: SAMtools
tools_dico.description: A software package with various utilities for processing alignments in the SAM format, including variant calling and alignment viewing.

markDuplicateReads.string_process:
process markDuplicateReads {
    label 'withMaxMemory'
    label 'withMaxCpus'
    label 'withMaxTime'
    container params.gatk4Image

    input:
    tuple val(name), path(bamFile)

    output:
    tuple val(name), path("${name}.marked.bam")

    script:
    """
    gatk --java-options -Xmx${task.memory.toGiga()}g \
        MarkDuplicates \
        -I ${bamFile} \
        -O "${name}.marked.bam" \
        -M "${name}.marked_dup_metrics.txt"
    """
}

tools_dico.name: GATK
tools_dico.description:
The Genome Analysis Toolkit (GATK) is a set of bioinformatic tools for analyzing high-throughput sequencing (HTS) and variant call format (VCF) data. Version 4 (GATK4) is open-source at https://github.com/broadinstitute/gatk.

tools_dico.name: MarkDuplicates (IP)
tools_dico.description: Marks all duplicate reads in a provided SAM or BAM file and either removes them or flags them.

addTagInfo.string_process:
process addTagInfo {
    label 'withMaxMemory'
    label 'withMaxCpus'
    label 'withMaxTime'
    container params.gatk4Image

    input:
    tuple val(name), path(bamFile)

    output:
    tuple val(name), path("${name}.fixed.bam")

    script:
    """
    gatk --java-options -Xmx${task.memory.toGiga()}g \
        SetNmMdAndUqTags \
        -R ${params.referenceSequence['path']} \
        -I ${bamFile} \
        -O "${name}.fixed.bam"
    """

}

tools_dico.name: GATK
tools_dico.description:
The Genome Analysis Toolkit (GATK) is a set of bioinformatic tools for analyzing high-throughput sequencing (HTS) and variant call format (VCF) data. The toolkit is well established for germline short variant discovery from whole genome and exome sequencing data. GATK4 expands functionality into copy number and somatic analyses and offers pipeline scripts for workflows.  

Version 4 (GATK4) is open-source at https://github.com/broadinstitute/gatk.

recalibrateBaseQualityScores.string_process:
process recalibrateBaseQualityScores {
    label 'withMaxMemory'
    label 'withMaxCpus'
    label 'withMaxTime'
    container params.gatk4Image

    input:
    tuple val(name), path(bamFile)

    output:
    tuple val(name), path("${name}.recal.bam")

    script:
    if ( file("${params.baseQualityRecalibrationTable}").exists() )
        """
        gatk ApplyBQSR \
            -R reference.fasta \
            -I ${bamFile} \
            --bqsr-recal-file ${params.baseQualityRecalibrationTable} \
            -O ${name}.recal.bam
        """
    else
        """
        ln -s ${bamFile} ${name}.recal.bam
        """
}
recalibrateBaseQualityScores.string_script:
if ( file("${params.baseQualityRecalibrationTable}").exists() )
        """
        gatk ApplyBQSR \
            -R reference.fasta \
            -I ${bamFile} \
            --bqsr-recal-file ${params.baseQualityRecalibrationTable} \
            -O ${name}.recal.bam
        """
    else
        """
        ln -s ${bamFile} ${name}.recal.bam
        """

tools_dico.description:
The Genome Analysis Toolkit (GATK) is a set of bioinformatic tools for analyzing high-throughput sequencing (HTS) and variant call format (VCF) data. checkBamFile.string_process:
process checkBamFile {
    label 'withMaxMemory'
    label 'withMaxCpus'
    label 'withMaxTime'
    container params.gatk4Image

    input:
    tuple val(name), path(bamFile)

    output:
    tuple val(name), path("${bamFile}")

    script:
    """
    gatk --java-options -Xmx${task.memory.toGiga()}g \
        ValidateSamFile \
        -I ${bamFile} \
        -R ${params.referenceSequence['path']} \
        --TMP_DIR ${params.tempDir} \
        -M VERBOSE
    """
}

tools_dico.name: GATK
tools_dico.description:
The Genome Analysis Toolkit (GATK) is a set of bioinformatic tools for analyzing high-throughput sequencing (HTS) and variant call format (VCF) data. The toolkit is well established for germline short variant discovery from whole genome and exome sequencing data. GATK4 expands functionality into copy number and somatic analyses and offers pipeline scripts for workflows.  

Version 4 (GATK4) is open-source at https://github.com/broadinstitute/gatk.

saveBamFileToOutputDir.string_process:
process saveBamFileToOutputDir {
    label 'withMaxMemory'
    label 'withMaxCpus'
    label 'withMaxTime'
    container params.samtoolsImage

    input:
    tuple val(name), path(bamFile)

    script:
    """
    mkdir -p ${params.alignedReadsDir}
    samtools view \
        -b \
        -o ${params.alignedReadsDir}/${name}.bam \
        ${bamFile}
    """
}

tools_dico.name: SAMtools
tools_dico.description: A software package with various utilities for processing alignments in the SAM format, including variant calling and alignment viewing.

indexInputBamFile.string_process:
process indexInputBamFile {
	label 'withMaxMemory'
	label 'withMaxCpus'
	label 'withMaxTime'
	container params.samtoolsImage

	input:
	tuple val(bamId), path(bamFile)

	output:
	tuple val(bamId), path(bamFile), path("${bamFile}.bai")

	script:
	"""
	samtools index \
		-b \
		-@ ${task.cpus} \
		${bamFile}
	"""
}

tools_dico.name: SAMtools
tools_dico.description: A software package with various utilities for processing alignments in the SAM format, including variant calling and alignment viewing.

callVariantsForEachSample.string_process:
process callVariantsForEachSample {
    label 'withMaxMemory'
    label 'withMaxCpus'
    label 'withMaxTime'
    container params.gatk4Image

	input:
	tuple val(bamId), path(bamFile), path(bamIndex)

	script:
	"""
    mkdir -p ${params.variantSetsDir}
    gatk --java-options "-Xmx${task.memory.toGiga()}g" \
		HaplotypeCaller \
		-R ${params.referenceSequence['path']} \
		-I ${bamFile} \
		-O ${params.variantSetsDir}/${bamId}.g.vcf \
		--lenient true \
		-ERC GVCF
	"""
}

tools_dico.name: GATK
tools_dico.description:
The Genome Analysis Toolkit (GATK) is a set of bioinformatic tools for analyzing high-throughput sequencing (HTS) and variant call format (VCF) data. The toolkit is well established for germline short variant discovery from whole genome and exome sequencing data. GATK4 expands functionality into copy number and somatic analyses and offers pipeline scripts for workflows.  

Version 4 (GATK4) is open-source at https://github.com/broadinstitute/gatk.

buildBwaIndex.string_process:
process buildBwaIndex {
	label 'withMaxMemory'
	label 'withMaxCpus'
	label 'withMaxTime'
    container params.bwaImage

	when:
	!file(params.referenceSequence['dir'] + 'bwa.' + params.referenceSequence['label'] + '.amb').exists()

	script:
	"""
	bwa index \
			-p ${params.referenceSequence['dir']}bwa.${params.referenceSequence['label']} \
			${params.referenceSequence['path']}
	"""
}

tools_dico.name: BWA
tools_dico.description: Fast, accurate, memory-efficient aligner for short and long sequencing reads

buildSamtoolsIndex.string_process:
process buildSamtoolsIndex {
	label 'withMaxMemory'
	label 'withMaxCpus'
	label 'withMaxTime'
    container params.samtoolsImage

	when:
	!file(params.referenceSequence['path'] + '.fai').exists()

	script:
	"""
	samtools faidx ${params.referenceSequence['path']}
	"""
}

tools_dico.name: SAMtools
tools_dico.description: A software package with various utilities for processing alignments in the SAM format, including variant calling and alignment viewing.

buildGATKDictionary.string_process:
process buildGATKDictionary {
	label 'withMaxMemory'
	label 'withMaxCpus'
	label 'withMaxTime'
    container params.gatk4Image

	when:
	!file(params.referenceSequence['dir'] + params.referenceSequence['label'] + '.dict').exists()

	script:
	"""
	gatk CreateSequenceDictionary \
			-R ${params.referenceSequence['path']} \
			-O ${params.referenceSequence['dir']}${params.referenceSequence['label']}'.dict'
	"""
}

tools_dico.name: GATK
tools_dico.description:
The Genome Analysis Toolkit (GATK) is a set of bioinformatic tools for analyzing high-throughput sequencing (HTS) and variant call format (VCF) data. The toolkit is well established for germline short variant discovery from whole genome and exome sequencing data. GATK4 expands functionality into copy number and somatic analyses and offers pipeline scripts for workflows.  

Version 4 (GATK4) is open-source at https://github.com/broadinstitute/gatk.

trimRawReads.string_process:
process trimRawReads {
	label 'withMaxMemory'
	label 'withMaxCpus'
	label 'withMaxTime'
    container params.trimmomaticImage

	input:
	tuple val(name), path(reads)

	script:
	"""
	mkdir -p ${params.trimmedReadsDir}
	java -jar ${params.trimmomaticJar} PE \
		-threads ${task.cpus} \
		${reads[0]} ${reads[1]} \
		${params.trimmedReadsDir}/${reads[0]} ${params.trimmedReadsDir}/unpaired_${reads[0]} \
		${params.trimmedReadsDir}/${reads[1]} ${params.trimmedReadsDir}/unpaired_${reads[1]} \
		LEADING:${params.trimLeadX} \
		TRAILING:${params.trimTrailX} \
		SLIDINGWINDOW:5:${params.trimMinAverageQuality} \
		MINLEN:${params.trimMinReadLength}
	"""
}
trimRawReads.string_script:
"""
	mkdir -p ${params.trimmedReadsDir}
	java -jar ${params.trimmomaticJar} PE \
		-threads ${task.cpus} \
		${reads[0]} ${reads[1]} \
		${params.trimmedReadsDir}/${reads[0]} ${params.trimmedReadsDir}/unpaired_${reads[0]} \
		${params.trimmedReadsDir}/${reads[1]} ${params.trimmedReadsDir}/unpaired_${reads[1]} \
		LEADING:${params.trimLeadX} \
		TRAILING:${params.trimTrailX} \
		SLIDINGWINDOW:5:${params.trimMinAverageQuality} \
		MINLEN:${params.trimMinReadLength}
	"""

printHelloWorldMessage.string_process:
process printHelloWorldMessage {

	input:
	val x

	output:
	stdout

	script:
	"""
	echo "${x}: hello world"
	echo "${launchDir}"
	echo "${params.rawReadsDir}"
	"""
}
